title: Synthetic Recap
body:
HOUSTON — In the crucible of a tight fourth quarter, one man refused to let his team lose. Clyde Drexler, facing his former team, authored a legendary performance, pouring in a career-high and franchise-record 41 points to will the Portland Trail Blazers to a thrilling 97-95 victory over the Houston Rockets.

The game was a tense, defensive struggle, with neither team able to secure a decisive advantage. But Drexler was a force of nature, operating on a different plane entirely. He was relentless, attacking the rim and scoring from all levels against a hapless Rockets defense. His 41-point explosion, a monumental figure in a game where the final tally didn't even reach 100, was the sole reason the Trail Blazers were in a position to win.

As the clock wound down, the Rockets, led by Charles Barkley's 25 points and 13 rebounds, refused to go quietly. The score was tied, and Houston had a chance to win it on their final possession. But Drexler’s heroics weren't limited to offense. In a final, poetic twist, it was "The Glide" who rose to the occasion on the other end of the floor, contesting the last shot to secure the heart-stopping two-point win for Portland.

On this night, Clyde Drexler wasn't just the best player on the court; he was the entire story. His record-setting effort, a blend of artistry and sheer will, was a one-man masterpiece that carved a path to victory for the Trail Blazers.
